clinical_study.brief_title: Postmarketing Surveillance Study of Atrovent® Inhalets in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Postmarketing Surveillance Study (as Per §67(6)AMG [German Drug Law]) of Atrovent® Inhalets in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: To obtain further information on the tolerability and efficacy of Atrovent® inhalets in the treatment of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease under conditions of daily practice

primary_outcome.measure: Investigator assessment of improvement of the clinical picture rated on a 6-point symptom profile
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after first drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of efficacy by investigator on a 4-point scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after first drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of efficacy by patient on a 4-point scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after first drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of tolerability by investigator on a 4-point scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after first drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of tolerability by patient on a 4-point scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after first drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse drug reactions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after first drug administration

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic obstructive airways disease recruited at general practitioners, pneumologists, internists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients of both gender, older than 40 years, who suffer from chronic obstructive Pulmonary disease
- Only patients who had not been treated with Atrovent® within the last year were to be considered for inclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
• Contraindications listed in the Instructions for Use/Summary of Product Characteristics for Atrovent® Inhalets
